org._7hills.liueri19.game

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • org._7hills.liueri19.game.Piece
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Piece>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook

    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Piece>
    Piece class is the super class of all pieces and defines most general methods.
    Author:
    liueri19

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Piece

        public Piece(Board board,
             boolean color,
             int x,
             int y)
        Constructs a new Piece object. This is the super constructor for all Piece subclasses. To construct a Piece object, use the constructor of the desired subclass.
        Parameters:
        board - the Board to set the piece on
        color - the color of the Piece, true for white, false for black
        x - the file to set the piece on
        y - the rank to set the piece on

        public java.util.List<Move> getLegalMoves()
        Returns a List of Move objects containing all legal moves. All moves not on this List is considered illegal.

        a List of Move objects containing all legal moves

        Parameters:

      • clearLegalMoves

        public void clearLegalMoves()
        Clear the list of legal moves. All moves are considered illegal after a call to this method.

        Returns:

        a List of Move objects representing the threats this Piece is posing

      • isThreatening

        public boolean isThreatening(Move move)
        Returns true if the specified Move is threatened, false otherwise.
        For pieces other than King and Pawn, this method is equivalent to isLegalMove().
        Parameters:
        move - the Move to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the specified Move is threatened, false otherwise

        public boolean move(int file,
                    int rank)
        Move this Piece to the specified location. Returns true if the move succeeds, and false if the move failed.
        Parameters:

        rank - the rank to move this Piece to
        Returns:
        true if the move succeeds, and false if the move failed

      • updatePiece

        public abstract void updatePiece(int[] square)
        Update the legal moves and threatened squares of this Piece with the specified location.
        Parameters:
        square - the square for the legal moves and threatened squares generation algorithms to run on

      • updatePiece

        public void updatePiece()
        Update the legal moves and threatened squares of this Piece using its current location.

      • toString

        public abstract java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of this Piece object.

        The subclasses are represented as:
        Pawn - P
        Rook - R
        Bishop - B
        Knight - N
        Queen - Q
        King - K

        The colors are represented as:
        Black - B
        White - W

        A Piece will be formated as:
        [color][type]
        A white Knight would be represented as WN, a black King would be represented as BK.

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String representation of this Piece object

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Piece piece)
        Compares this Piece to the specified Piece based on their location on the board. The Piece with a higher rank is considered greater; if two Piece objects have the same rank, the Piece with a greater file is considered greater. Piece objects on the same location are considered equal.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Piece>
        Parameters:
        piece - the Piece to be compared
        Returns:
        -1, 0, or 1 as this Piece is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified Piece.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object piece)
        Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this Piece. This method only checks if the specified method is the same class as this Piece.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        piece - the Object to be compared with
        Returns:
        true if the specified Object is an instance of the same class as this Piece, false otherwise
